channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Labor Abuses Abroad
item.description: We explain why, despite scrutiny, serious labor abuses still lurk in major companies’ supply chains.

item.title: Landslides Hit Kerala in India, Killing More Than 60
item.description: Rescue workers struggled to reach isolated villages in the state of Kerala, where torrential rains washed away terrain. The death toll was expected to rise.

item.title: Senate set to pass internet safety bill pushed by parents of kids who died by suicide
item.description: It would be the first major effort by Congress in decades to hold tech companies more accountable for the harm that they cause.

item.title: Trump Ad Attacks Harris, and Protests Erupt in Venezuela
item.description: Plus, the skyrocketing toll of cybercrime.

item.title: Olympic Men’s Triathlon Postponed Because of Pollution in the Seine
item.description: Water-quality tests early Tuesday showed that the river running through Paris was unsafe for swimming, organizers said.

item.title: California man fights state’s largest wildfire to within 70 feet of his house one month after insurance company drops his coverage
item.description: Ron Ward had lost insurance coverage as companies increasingly drop California homeowners due to the growing risk of wildfires in the state, in part due to hotter weather and arid conditions caused by climate change.

item.title: Trump’s First Major Ad Attacking Harris Hits Her on Immigration
item.description: The spot, running on television in six battleground states, reflects an effort by the former president to center immigration that predates Kamala Harris’s rise to the top of the Democratic ticket.

item.title: How Did Venezuela Get Here?
item.description: A movement started by Hugo Chávez, promising power to the people, became an authoritarian regime, one that opponents say just stole an election.

item.title: White House says there’s no need to restrict ‘open source’ AI—for now at least
item.description: “We recognize the importance of open systems," said Alan Davidson, an assistant secretary of the U.S. Commerce Department.

item.title: How Did the Park Fire in Northern California Get So Big?
item.description: The blaze has been fed largely by exceptionally dry vegetation following more than a month of extreme heat in California.

item.title: Olympic Surfing Comes to a ‘Poisoned’ Paradise
item.description: In 1974, a radioactive cloud from a French nuclear test drifted over Teahupo’o, Tahiti, now the surfing venue for the Paris Games. Villagers still feel the effects.

item.title: Trump says he ‘can also make a case for not’ debating Kamala Harris
item.description: Trump, in an interview with Fox News Channel that aired Monday night, was pressed several times about committing to debating Harris before giving a squishier answer than he had in recent days.

item.title: Chinese E.V. Makers Are Upending Thailand’s Auto Market
item.description: China’s electric vehicle companies are making inroads in Thailand, a key industry hub, as Europe and the United States wield tariffs to keep them out.

item.title: You Won’t See Them at the Olympics, but These Speed Puzzlers Are World-Class
item.description: Puzzling has been around for more than 250 years, but a budding tournament featuring participants from more than 75 countries in Spain is giving it new life.

item.title: Johnnie Walker maker Diageo sees first sales drop since the pandemic—but Guinness and ready-made cocktails save the day
item.description: Diageo’s CEO Debra Crew said that despite pockets of weakness, the “merit of our portfolio is that we really do have very broad options for the consumer.”
